title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 14-1.83 - Reheating
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 14-1.83 - Reheating

State Regulations
(a) The entire mass of all precooked, refrigerated, potentially hazardous food that is to be reheated must be heated to 165 degrees Fahrenheit (73.9 degrees Celsius) or above within two hours and held above 140 degrees Fahrenheit (60 degrees Celsius) until served. (b) Precooked potentially hazardous foods from commercially processed hermetically sealed containers and precooked potentially hazardous foods in intact packages from commercial food processing establishments that are to be heated for the first time within the food service establishment must be heated to 140 degrees Fahrenheit (60 degrees Celsius) within two hours and held above 140 degrees Fahrenheit (60 degrees Celsius) until served. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10

14-1.83

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
